question.title: Will a member of the Trump family be the Republican nominee for the US Presidency in 2024?
question.body:
Resolution Criteria
Resolves Yes if one of these individuals is the Republican nominee for the US Presidency in 2024:
Donald Trump
Donald Trump Jr.
Eric Trump
Ivanka Trump
Tiffany Trump
Melania Trump
Barron Trump

Q.title: Before 2025, will at least two public health agencies claim that China deliberately misreported COVID-19 infections?
Q.body:
Resolution Criteria
The COVID-19 outbreak in China has been rife with allegations of misrepresentation by Chinese government officials. These began at the local level, where officials in Hubei province potentially under-reported the magnitude of the outbreak in early January to Chinese central government authorities. A public health worker famously released a video around January 26 claiming that at that time, at least 90,000 cases had occurred--at the time the Chinese government was reporting fewer than 2000 infections. Since then, the insufficiently-inclusive strategy of counting only persons with laboratory-confirmed cases of COVID-19 depressed the counts of probable cases. And the patterns of growth in the official counts follow an unexpected distribution, implying the counts may be generated by a model which doesn't accurately represent the dynamics of the disease's spread through the population.
This latter allegation is perhaps the most important and severe, as it means that estimations of epidemiological characteristics based on Chinese data may lead to public health interventions which do not reflect the reality of the viral spread. For example, if the R_0 (the average number of people an infected person will pass the virus along to) is underestimated, it may lead to insufficiently aggressive strategies for reducing the propagation of the virus across the globe. However, overestimating it could lead to overly-aggressive quarantining strategies, hobbling international commerce. Getting a proper assessment of the epidemiological dynamics is critical to devising the appropriate public health response.
Will at least two public health agencies publicly accuse the Chinese government of deliberately misrepresenting the number of COVID-19 infections before 2025?
This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2025, at least two of the public health agencies listed below claim that it is more likely than not that the Chinese government deliberately lied about, fabricated, or misrepresented case or death numbers. If an agency claims that the numbers were flawed, but does not go as far as to suggest deliberate lying or misrepresentation, this will not count. For the purpose of this question, we consider only statements by the following public health agencies:
Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (including the Epidemic Intelligence Service)
The European Centre for Disease Prevention and Control (including the Health Threat Unit)
World Health Organization
The Chinese Center for Disease Control and Prevention
The Centre for Health Protection
Robert Koch Institute
The National Institute of Infectious Diseases
Public Health England
The National Centre for Infectious Diseases
Centers for Disease Control and Prevention Korea
The Public Health Agency of Canada
In case multiple subdivisions of any of the above agencies make assessments that China more likely than not lied about case or death numbers, these will only count as single accusation made by a single agency.
The relevant assessments will count if they are judged by Metaculus to broadly state that it is more likely than not that the Chinese government deliberately did lie about, fabricate, or misrepresent case or death counts.
This question has a short-fuse sister.

P_given_Q.title: Given that at least two public health agencies claim that China deliberately misreported COVID-19 infections, will a member of the Trump family be the Republican nominee for the US Presidency in 2024?
P_given_Q.body:
Before 2025, it is alleged that the COVID-19 outbreak in China was rife with misrepresentation by Chinese government officials, leading to accusations of deliberate lying or misrepresentation regarding COVID-19 infections. The resolution criteria for this condition is that at least two of the specified public health agencies must state that it is more likely than not that the Chinese government deliberately lied about or misrepresented COVID-19 case or death numbers before January 1, 2025. 

On the other hand, the outcome question resolves Yes if any of the following members of the Trump family is the Republican nominee for the US Presidency in 2024: Donald Trump, Donald Trump Jr., Eric Trump, Ivanka Trump, Tiffany Trump, Melania Trump, or Barron Trump.

P_given_not_Q.title: Given that no public health agencies will claim that China deliberately misreported COVID-19 infections before 2025, will a member of the Trump family be the Republican nominee for the US Presidency in 2024?
P_given_not_Q.body:

These began at the local level, where officials in Hubei province potentially under-reported the magnitude of the outbreak in early January to Chinese central government authorities. And the patterns of growth in the official counts follow an unexpected distribution, implying the counts may be generated by a model which doesn't accurately represent the dynamics of the disease's spread through the population.
This latter allegation is perhaps the most important and severe, as it means that estimations of epidemiological characteristics based on Chinese data may lead to public health interventions which do not reflect the reality of the viral spread. For example, if the R_0 (the average number of people an infected person will pass the virus along to) is underestimated, it may lead to insufficiently aggressive strategies for reducing the propagation of the virus across the globe. However, overestimating it could lead to overly-aggressive quarantining strategies, hobbling international commerce. Getting a proper assessment of the epidemiological dynamics is critical to devising the appropriate public health response.
Will no public health agencies publicly accuse the Chinese government of deliberately misrepresenting the number of COVID-19 infections before 2025? This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2025, none of the public health agencies listed below claim that it is more likely than not that the Chinese government deliberately lied about, fabricated, or misrepresented case or death numbers. If an agency claims that the numbers were flawed, but does not go as far as to suggest deliberate lying or misrepresentation, this will not count. For the purpose of this question, we consider only statements by the following public health agencies:
Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (including the Epidemic Intelligence Service)

World Health Organization

The Centre for Health Protection

The relevant assessments will count if they are judged by Metaculus to broadly state that it is more likely than not that the Chinese government deliberately did lie about, fabricate, or misrepresent case or death counts.
This question has a short-fuse sister.

Resolution Criteria for the outcome: Resolves Yes if one of the following individuals is the Republican nominee for the US Presidency in 2024: Donald Trump, Donald Trump Jr., Eric Trump, Ivanka Trump, Tiffany Trump, Melania Trump, Barron Trump.

question.title: Will no member of the Trump family be the Republican nominee for the US Presidency in 2024?
question.body:
Resolution Criteria
Resolves Yes if none of these individuals is the Republican nominee for the US Presidency in 2024:
Donald Trump
Donald Trump Jr.
Eric Trump
Ivanka Trump
Tiffany Trump
Melania Trump
Barron Trump

Q.title: Will there be at least 2˚C of global warming by 2100?
Q.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve positively if, by January 1, 2100, there has been a period of at least 5 consecutive years in which the average global temperature in each year was at least 2.0 ˚C greater than the average global temperature in 1880.
(Note that 1880 isn't exactly pre-industrial, but earlier data is highly unreliable, and there should really not have been much warming by then.)
Data for resolution shall come from NASA, if possible. Note that the data in the link is normalised relative to the 1951-1980 baseline, on which 1880 stands at -0.2. Therefore, the critical value to look for with this specific NASA dataset will be 1.8 ˚C. It is likely, though, that the link will no longer be active in a few decades, so a different dataset may have to be used anyway.
The last possible set of 5 years to satisfy the requirement would be 2095-2099, so the last possible resolution date would be around mid-2100, in order to make sure that there are no uncertainties regarding the 2099 climate data

P_given_Q.title: Given there will be at least 2˚C of global warming by 2100, will no member of the Trump family be the Republican nominee for the US Presidency in 2024?
P_given_Q.body:
Suppose the following is true: By January 1, 2100, there has been a period of at least 5 consecutive years in which the average global temperature in each year was at least 2.0 ˚C greater than the average global temperature in 1880.

Then, will it resolve Yes if none of these individuals is the Republican nominee for the US Presidency in 2024: Donald Trump, Donald Trump Jr., Eric Trump, Ivanka Trump, Tiffany Trump, Melania Trump, and Barron Trump? 

Resolution criteria: Resolves Yes if none of the listed individuals is the Republican nominee for the US Presidency in 2024.

P_given_not_Q.title: Given that there will be less than 2˚C of global warming by 2100, will no member of the Trump family be the Republican nominee for the US Presidency in 2024?
P_given_not_Q.body:
Resolution criteria for the condition: This question will resolve positively if, by January 1, 2100, there has not been a period of at least 5 consecutive years in which the average global temperature in each year was at least 2.0 ˚C greater than the average global temperature in 1880. Data for resolution shall come from NASA, if possible. 

Resolution criteria for the outcome: Resolves Yes if none of the following individuals is the Republican nominee for the US Presidency in 2024: Donald Trump, Donald Trump Jr., Eric Trump, Ivanka Trump, Tiffany Trump, Melania Trump, and Barron Trump.

question.title: If Joe Biden is elected president of the US in 2020, will the highest tax bracket be restored to its original 39.6% or higher before 2025?
question.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve as Yes if Joe Biden is elected president for the 2021-2024 term, and the upper tax bracket for US single tax payers is increased to at least 39.6% by January 1, 2025. If Biden is elected but the upper tax bracket is not increased to at least 39.6%, this question will resolve as No.
If Biden is not elected President in 2020, this question will resolve as Ambiguous

Q.title: Will there be at least 2˚C of global warming by 2100?
Q.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve positively if, by January 1, 2100, there has been a period of at least 5 consecutive years in which the average global temperature in each year was at least 2.0 ˚C greater than the average global temperature in 1880.

P_given_Q.title: Given that there will be at least 2˚C of global warming by 2100, will the highest tax bracket be restored to its original 39.6% or higher before 2025?
P_given_Q.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve positively if, by January 1, 2100, there has been a period of at least 5 consecutive years in which the average global temperature in each year was at least 2.0 ˚C greater than the average global temperature in 1880. 

If Joe Biden is elected president for the 2021-2024 term, and the upper tax bracket for US single tax payers is increased to at least 39.6% by January 1, 2025, this question will resolve as Yes. If Biden is elected but the upper tax bracket is not increased to at least 39.6%, this question will resolve as No. If Biden is not elected President in 2020, this question will resolve as Ambiguous.

P_given_not_Q.title: Given that there will be less than 2˚C of global warming by 2100, will the highest tax bracket be restored to its original 39.6% or higher before 2025?
P_given_not_Q.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve positively if, by January 1, 2100, there has not been a period of at least 5 consecutive years in which the average global temperature in each year was at least 2.0 ˚C greater than the average global temperature in 1880. 

Additionally, this question will resolve as Yes if Joe Biden is elected president for the 2021-2024 term, and the upper tax bracket for US single tax payers is increased to at least 39.6% by January 1, 2025. If Biden is elected but the upper tax bracket is not increased to at least 39.6%, this question will resolve as No. If Biden is not elected President in 2020, this question will resolve as Ambiguous.

question.title: If Joe Biden is elected president of the US in 2020, will the highest tax bracket not be restored to its original 39.6% or higher before 2025?
question.body:

Q.title: Will we detect an exoplanet atmosphere with >5% oxygen atmosphere before 2030?
Q.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve as Yes if any exoplanet with >5% O2 atmosphere is found before January 1, 2030

P_given_Q.title: Given that we detect an exoplanet atmosphere with >5% oxygen atmosphere before 2030, will the highest tax bracket not be restored to its original 39.6% or higher before 2025?
P_given_Q.body:
Suppose the following is true: We detect an exoplanet atmosphere with >5% oxygen atmosphere before January 1, 2030. Then will Joe Biden being elected president of the US in 2020 lead to the highest tax bracket not being restored to its original 39.6% or higher before January 1, 2025? 

Resolution Criteria for the condition: This question will resolve as Yes if any exoplanet with >5% O2 atmosphere is found before January 1, 2030.

Resolution Criteria for the outcome: This question will resolve as Yes if Joe Biden is elected president for the 2021-2024 term, and the upper tax bracket for US single tax payers is not increased to at least 39.6% by January 1, 2025. If Biden is elected and the upper tax bracket is increased to at least 39.6%, this question will resolve as No. If Biden is not elected President in 2020, this question will resolve as Ambiguous.

P_given_not_Q.title: Given that we will not detect an exoplanet atmosphere with >5% oxygen before 2030, will the highest tax bracket not be restored to its original 39.6% or higher before 2025?
P_given_not_Q.body:
Suppose the following is true: No exoplanet with >5% O2 atmosphere is found before January 1, 2030. Then, if Joe Biden is elected president for the 2021-2024 term, will the upper tax bracket for US single tax payers not be increased to at least 39.6% by January 1, 2025? 

Resolution Criteria: This question will resolve as Yes if Joe Biden is elected president for the 2021-2024 term, and the upper tax bracket for US single tax payers is not increased to at least 39.6% by January 1, 2025. If Biden is elected and the upper tax bracket is increased to at least 39.6%, this question will resolve as No. If Biden is not elected President in 2020, this question will resolve as Ambiguous.

question.title: Will the price of water on the NQH20 hit $2,500 (2021 USD) per acre-foot by 2050?
question.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve positively if the price of water hits $2500, adjusted for inflation to 2021 USD, on the NQH20 by 2050-01-01, 00:00 UTC. This question resolves negatively if the price of water does not hit $2500 by that date, and it resolves ambiguously if the NQH20 or a similar exchange doesn't continuously track California water prices up until 2050

Q.title: Will there be at least 2˚C of global warming by 2100?
Q.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve positively if, by January 1, 2100, there has been a period of at least 5 consecutive years in which the average global temperature in each year was at least 2.0 ˚C greater than the average global temperature in 1880.
(Note that 1880 isn't exactly pre-industrial, but earlier data is highly unreliable, and there should really not have been much warming by then.)
Data for resolution shall come from NASA, if possible. Note that the data in the link is normalised relative to the 1951-1980 baseline, on which 1880 stands at -0.2. Therefore, the critical value to look for with this specific NASA dataset will be 1.8 ˚C. It is likely, though, that the link will no longer be active in a few decades, so a different dataset may have to be used anyway.
The last possible set of 5 years to satisfy the requirement would be 2095-2099, so the last possible resolution date would be around mid-2100, in order to make sure that there are no uncertainties regarding the 2099 climate data

P_given_Q.title: Given that there will be at least 2˚C of global warming by 2100, will the price of water on the NQH20 hit $2,500 (2021 USD) per acre-foot by 2050?
P_given_Q.body:
Suppose the following is true: By January 1, 2100, there has been a period of at least 5 consecutive years in which the average global temperature in each year was at least 2.0 ˚C greater than the average global temperature in 1880. 
Then, will the price of water hit $2500 (adjusted for inflation to 2021 USD) on the NQH20 by 2050-01-01, 00:00 UTC? 
Resolution criteria for the outcome: This question will resolve positively if the price of water hits $2500, adjusted for inflation to 2021 USD, on the NQH20 by the specified date. It resolves negatively if it does not hit that price, and it resolves ambiguously if the NQH20 or a similar exchange doesn't continuously track California water prices up until 2050.

P_given_not_Q.title: Given that there will be less than 2˚C of global warming by 2100, will the price of water on the NQH20 hit $2,500 (2021 USD) per acre-foot by 2050?
P_given_not_Q.body:
Resolution Criteria: 
This question will resolve positively if, by January 1, 2100, there has not been a period of at least 5 consecutive years in which the average global temperature in each year was at least 2.0 ˚C greater than the average global temperature in 1880. 

Additionally, this question will resolve positively if the price of water hits $2500, adjusted for inflation to 2021 USD, on the NQH20 by 2050-01-01, 00:00 UTC. 

This question resolves negatively if the price of water does not hit $2500 by that date, and it resolves ambiguously if the NQH20 or a similar exchange doesn't continuously track California water prices up until 2050.
